doc.repnme: Servicios sostenibles con nuevos modelos de gestion para las pequenas ciudades del Peru
doc.abstracts: In the majority of the small localities of Peru, the municipalities offer water services and sanitation, and take all the decisions about the service and tariffs. Of the 650 small localities of the country, 150 have water services and sanitation administered by water and sanitation enterprises (EPS), which are property of the municipalities and are regulated by the National Supervision of Services of Sanitation (SUNASS). In the 500 remaining ones, the service is given directly by the provincial municipalities or districts. Nonetheless, according to the results of a study, two of the services administered by the local government are characterized by low coverage; tariffs that do not allow to recover the costs of services rendered; indiscriminate subsidies in spite of the municipal budget limitations; inadequate operation and maintenance; deficient management; political interference; high rotation of the personnel of service; delays in tariffs payment, and lack of will of payment of the users, due to the bad quality of the service.
